intro: Sorocea sprucei subsp. saxicola, commonly known as the saxicola sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to high-altitude environments in the Andes. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
